thread.title: Yamhill County deputies search for man who robbed bank at gunpoint
thread.title_full: Yamhill County deputies search for man who robbed bank at gunpoint | OregonLive.com

author: Nuran Alteir | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Yamhill County deputies search for man who robbed bank at gunpoint
text:
Authorities are looking for a man accused of robbing a U.S. Bank at gunpoint on Friday.
The incident happened at about 2 p.m. in Dayton. Armed with what appeared to be a sawed off shotgun, the man entered the bank and demanded money, Yamhill County Sheriff's Office spokesman Sgt. Richard Geist said in a news release. He left on foot with an undisclosed amount of cash.
Photos of the suspect show a man wearing a light colored hooded sweatshirt, long khaki shorts and white high top shoes. He is described as being around 5 feet 6 inches tall and weighs 220 pounds. He has short, dark hair with longer sideburns.
The FBI is assisting the sheriff's office in investigating the case.
Anyone with information about the robbery or recognizes the man in the photos is asked to contact Detective Kevin Gardner at 503-434-7506 or gardnerk@co.yamhill.or .
This is the second U.S. Bank robbed this week.
